definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
variant of 針|针[zhen1], needle
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]

sentences.english: Don't worry, he's still full of one-liners and quips.
sentences.chinese: 别担心，他仍然满嘴俏皮话一针见血。

sentences.english: Your analysis really hit the nail on the head.
sentences.chinese: 你的分析确实一针见血。

sentences.english: Sakamoto Ryoma Museum Curator Shiro Mori pointed out sharply that health.
sentences.chinese: 坂本龙马纪念馆馆长森健志郎一针见血地指出。

sentences.english: With heart-piercing accuracy, Jesus states that hard-heartedness causes marriage breakdown.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣一针见血地指出，是人的心硬导致了婚姻破裂。

sentences.english: She always analyzes problems in a simple and direct way.
sentences.chinese: 分析问题都很简截，却往往一针见血。

sentences.english: To find out the truth you have to ask the right questions.
sentences.chinese: 问题要问得一针见血，方能看清真相。

sentences.english: Zhang Bin, sometimes you could see straight, can also pierce to the heart of the matter.
sentences.chinese: 张斌，有时你看问题很准，也能一针见血。

sentences.english: His remarks always hit the nail on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他的评论总是一针见血。

sentences.english: The logic in the page is fairly simple, but it illustrates the point.
sentences.chinese: 页面中的逻辑相当简单，但一针见血。

definition: to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
penetrated/trenchant/incisive
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
pertinent/apropos
clear and penetrating (e.g. analysis)/incisive/insightful
concise and comprehensive (idiom)
to hit home on the evils of the day (idiom); fig. to hit a current political target/to hit the nub of the matter
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
to hit the nail on the head (idiom)
see 一語中的|一语中的[yi1 yu3 zhong4 di4]
to criticize/to refute
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
frank (discussion)/blunt/open
frank/open/blunt
